steps.title: Slice the melon into quarters.
steps.content: Slice the melon into quarters. Put your pepino melon on your cutting board and cut lengthwise right through the middle of the fruit with a chef’s knife. Pepino melons don’t have a pit, so you cut through them easily. Then, slice each of the pieces in half again to have smaller slices to enjoy. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Peel off the skin.
steps.content: Peel off the skin. Even though pepino melon skin is edible, it starts to develop a thicker, woody texture and an unappetizing flavor. [2] X Research source Once you’ve cut the melon, just grab the edge of the skin to tear it off of the fruit easily. [3] X Research source If the skin doesn’t easily peel off, scoop the fruit out with a spoon or use a knife to cut the skin off.

steps.title: Scoop the seeds out.
steps.content: Scoop the seeds out. Pepino melon seeds are edible and there are only a few in the center of the fruit, but they may have an unpleasant texture. Use a spoon or knife to remove the seeds and throw them away if you don’t want to eat them. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Eat fresh pepino by itself to enjoy its flavor.
steps.content: Eat fresh pepino by itself to enjoy its flavor. Pepino on its own tastes great and makes a great snack in the middle of the day. Just munch on slices or cubes of pepino melon when you want something cool and refreshing to fill you up. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Wrap pepino melon in prosciutto for a sweet and salty bite.
steps.content: Wrap pepino melon in prosciutto for a sweet and salty bite. Melon and prosciutto is a classic snack for a charcuterie board, and it tastes great with pepino melon. Just use a toothpick or skewer to hold the pepino melon and prosciutto together. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Include pepino melon in a salad for hints of sweetness.
steps.content: Include pepino melon in a salad for hints of sweetness. Toss some cubed pepino melon with some slices of cherry tomatoes, green peppers, and red peppers. Sprinkle on some feta cheese and fresh parsley before adding a pinch of black pepper and a dash of olive oil. [7] X Research source You can also use pepino as a substitute for honeydew or melon when you make a fruit salad .

steps.title: Enjoy a yogurt parfait with pepino melon for a healthy snack.
steps.content: Enjoy a yogurt parfait with pepino melon for a healthy snack. Scoop some yogurt into a bowl and mix in cubes of pepino melon and any other fruit you like to make your parfait. Sprinkle some granola into the yogurt for some added crunch too. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Poach pepino melon in sugar for a sweet treat.
steps.content: Poach pepino melon in sugar for a sweet treat. Poaching in sugar enhances the fruit’s natural sweetness. Blanch a full pepino melon in boiling water for 3 minutes. Then, dip the pepino melon in an ice bath for 1 minute. After that, pull the peel off of the fruit and cut it into cubes with your knife. Put the melon pieces in a pot with 1 cup (240 ml) of water, ½ cup (100 g) of sugar, and 1 tsp (1.4 g) of cinnamon for about 5 minutes before serving them. [9] X Research source Try putting your poached pepino melons on top of ice cream or cake if you want an even sweeter, fruitier flavor.

steps.title: Try a pepino melon and mango smoothie for a refreshing drink.
steps.content: Try a pepino melon and mango smoothie for a refreshing drink. Start by cutting 2 mangos into cubes and adding the pieces to your blender. Scoop the seeds out and cut the pepino melon into cubes as well. Add the pepino melon and 1 ⁄ 4 cup (59 ml) of milk to your blender. Run the blender until the fruit has a smooth consistency to make your smoothie. [10] X Research source Drop a couple of ice cubes in your blender to help cool your smoothie down.

steps.title: Make pepino melon salsa for a slightly spicy topping.
steps.content: Make pepino melon salsa for a slightly spicy topping. Whisk together 1 ⁄ 4 cup (59 ml) of honey, 2 1 ⁄ 2 tablespoons (37 ml) of balsamic vinegar, and ½ tsp (1.6 g) of chile flakes in a bowl. Cube 2 or 3 ripe pepino melons, ⅓ cup (50 g) of figs, ½ cup (85 g) of sliced grapes, ½ cup (65 g) of pecans, and 2 sliced scallions in another bowl. Toss the pepino melon mixture in the honey and balsamic, and add a sprinkle of salt and pepper before serving the salsa. Pepino melon salsa tastes great paired with any protein, so try it on chicken, whitefish, or pork for a really tasty meal.

steps.title: Cook unripe pepino melon for a stronger cucumber flavor.
steps.content: Cook unripe pepino melon for a stronger cucumber flavor. If you’d rather try pepino melon in savory dishes, you can cook it like squash while the skin is still green and the fruit feels firm. [11] X Research source Slice the pepino melon into cubes and toss the pieces in some oil, salt, and pepper. Set your oven to 450 °F (232 °C) and bake the pepino melon for about 20 minutes to soften the pieces and make them edible. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Pepino melon tastes like a mix of cucumber and honeydew.
steps.content: Pepino melon tastes like a mix of cucumber and honeydew. Fresh pepino melon has notes of cucumber, cantaloupe, honeydew, and pear. [13] X Research source When they’re ripe, they have a texture similar to a plum. Before they ripen, pepino melons are firmer and have a more pronounced cucumber taste. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Pepino melon turns bright yellow with purple stripes when it’s ripe.
steps.content: Pepino melon turns bright yellow with purple stripes when it’s ripe. When pepino melon is unripe, it has a green or pale white color. Wait until the pepino melon develops yellow skin and forms purple stripes to know that it’s ready to eat. You’ll also notice a sweet, fragrant smell similar to cantaloupe as it ripens. [15] X Research source Ripe pepino melons can bruise easily, so handle them carefully. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Pepino melons are great sources of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants.
steps.content: Pepino melons are great sources of vitamins, minerals, and antioxidants. Pepino melons are rich with vitamins A, B, C, and K, as well as minerals like iron, zinc, copper, manganese, calcium, potassium, and phosphorus. [17] X Research source
